docs.lead_paragraph: HEALTH OF CHARLESTON, S. C -There have been but two deaths from yellow fever in the last four days. We have made careful inquiries, aud find that this indication of the departure of the epidemic, is confirmed by the general report of the physicians. In the Marine Hospital,

headline.main: POLITICAL INTELLIGENCE.; Fifth Congressional District. Letter from Peter Cooper. The Practical Democrats--Note from E.A. Stansbury. Esq. Address of the Temperance State Central Committee

docs.lead_paragraph: Having assumed a bold and Independent position before the public in reference to a nomination for Congress, I suddenly find that certain parties are disposed to take advantage of that position to promote their own ends, and am compel d reluctantly again to appear in print.
docs.snippet: Having assumed a bold and Independent position before the public in reference to a nomination for Congress, I suddenly find that certain parties are disposed to take advantage of that position to promote their own ends, and am compel d reluctantly...

headline.main: LATER FROM HAVANA.; Arrival of the Black Warrior--Summary of Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamer Black Warrior, frcm Havana, Oct 28, arrived yesterday morning. It was rumored there that the Spanish fleet were about to cruise along our coast, for purposes of observation. The following from our correspondent gives all the intelligence of any interest by this arrival:

docs.lead_paragraph: A RETURNED LIBERIAN.-THOMAS CHESTER, Esq., a colored native of Harrisburg, who has been residing in Liberia for the last eighteen months, called on us yesterday. He bears with him a certificate, under the broad seal, that he is an Attorney-at-Law, in rood standing,

headline.main: THE MAYORALTY.; Correspondence between New-York Merchants and John J. Herrick. Esq.

docs.lead_paragraph: John J. Herrich, Esq.: DEAR SIR : We, the undersigned, have seen with great satisfaction your nomination for the office of Mayor, by a large and influential body of your fellow-citizens, and are induced in the exercise of our franchise, independent of all party considerations, to ask a reply to the questions herein, respecting your official course, if elected.

headline.main: FRANCE.; The Russian Prisoners--Political Memoranda. Personal, Literary and Miscellaneous Gossip.

docs.lead_paragraph: I mentioned lately that I did not know to what use the Russian General BODISCO, captured at Bomarsund, was to be put. I have learned since. He is made to predict the fall of Sebastopol.
docs.snippet: I mentioned lately that I did not know to what use the Russian General BODISCO, captured at Bomarsund, was to be put. I have learned since. He is made to predict the fall of Sebastopol.

byline.original: Special Correspondence of the N. Y. Daily Times.DICK TINTO

headline.main: The Yellow Fever--Death of Lieutenant Governor Farger, of Louisiana.

docs.lead_paragraph: The total number of interments in this city during the past week has been 243, including 107 from yellow fever. Lieutenant-Governor FARGER died of the yellow fever yesterday morning.
docs.snippet: The total number of interments in this city during the past week has been 243, including 107 from yellow fever. Lieutenant-Governor FARGER died of the yellow fever yesterday morning.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; LAW INTELLIGENCE. A New-York Fugitive Arrested. Officer Bowyer not Dead. SUPREME COURT--SPECIAL TERM--Nov. 1. SUPREME COURT--CIRCUIT, Nov. 1.

docs.lead_paragraph: Suicide of a Literary Lady. A lady writer, named ANN JANE McLANE, who has contributed largely to the Sunday Dispatch of this City, committed suicide yesterday by taking laudanum. oung lady was 24 years of age,
